result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew H Kotar

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew H Kotar in court.  Attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill III in court for Matthew H Kotar.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew H Kotar in court.  Attorney Vincent Hauser for Attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill III in court for Matthew H Kotar.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held, case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 087414,
Payable Number: 1031870,
Receipt Number: 22RP036749,
Amount: $20.00
Indigency hearing on September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
All conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Matthew H Kotar in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel; he's not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel and has not retained private.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,000.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

11:57 AM Defendant Matthew H Kotar not in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michael L M

Defendant Matthew H Kotar in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Matthew H Kotar in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew H Kotar appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense motion to dismiss count 1 argued and denied by the court. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
